Sequence Information.Source: sequence reversal, sequence shuffling, designed, man-made sequences

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (48%) toOmega76W: 33%, R: 25%; P: 17%.Activity: active against Gram+ E. faecalis PCM 2673 (MIC 64 ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC 25923 or 9144 (MIC 64-128 ug/ml), S. pneumoniae ATCC 49619 (MIC 4 ug/ml), Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 or 23506 (MIC 2-8 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae ATCC 700603 (MIC 0.25 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa ATCC 9027 (MIC 2 ug/ml), fungi  A. niger ATCC 16404 (MIC 32 ug/ml), C.albicans ATCC 10231 (MIC 256 ug/ml), and C.glabrata ATCC 15126 (MIC 128 ug/ml).In vitro toxicity: 4% human RBC: not hemo.lytic till 512 ug/ml.Structure:  less helical in SDS or DPC after sequence reversal.
Literature Information.Author: Neubauer D, Jaskiewicz M, Migon D, Bauer M, Sikora K, Sikorska E, Kamysz E, Kamysz W. 2017
Literature Information.Title: Retro analog concept: comparative study on physico-chemical and biological properties of selected antimicrobial peptides.
